content.headline: Graphic designer and frontend developer
content.summary:
My name is Freddy PolanÃ­a. I am a graphic designer and front-end web developer who likes to build web applications to improve the user experience. I'm intestered in participate in the creation and design of web products to combine usability and design properly. I like to do UI, logos, display letters, icons. HMTL / CSS / JS is the power combo ðŸ’¥ðŸ’»ðŸ’¥.

I have managed projects from logo design, printed and digital branding in commercial stationery, catalogs, graphic identity manuals to websites, interactive presentations and social media campaigns. Also, I have participated and directed projects of static and dynamic websites, implementation of templates in proprietary and open source CMS, development of PWA applications in front-end libraries using HTML5, CSS3 and Javascript.
content.story:
I graduated from the Darias Design Institute in 2013. Previously, I studied computer engineering and became interested in web design, to the point that I changed of career. In Darias, I learned the basics of design, typography, illustration, corporate identity, photography, among many other things. I completed HTML / Flash courses and this is how I started making my first web pages.

Â  I worked as director's assistant of Darias Institue in 2008 in charge of the school's website. I participated in the installation of the Latin American typography exhibition Latin Types in the Museum of Design and Prints Carlos Cruz-Diez. That same, year I got my first web designer job and met the content managers; There I started taking the first steps with CSS style sheets to improve the appearance of HTML views.

In October 2014, a website I made for Banco del Libro was selected to participate in the IDB Latin American Design Biennial of the same year in the digital design category. I collaborated in the development and design of the website for the Design Congress [Caracas Design](https://www.facebook.com/groups/caracasdesign/) in its 2013, 2014 and 2015 editions. At the beginning of 2019 I certified myself as a front-end web developer; Since January 2010 I have been director and manager in the areas of design and front-end web development projects at Novanet.
content.seo_description: Freddy PolanÃ­a, graphic designer and front-end web developer who likes to build web applications to improve the user experience.

content.description: Santiago de LeÃ³n de **Caracas**, capital of Venezuela. City where I was born and where I live.

content.title: Dr.MacQ  logo
content.description:
One of the requirements for this logo was to resemble in some way the main brand, for this reason, it was decided to retain the same typography and the shape of human torso. Dr.MacQ logo was designed for a telemedicine mobile application, the torso is inscribed in a "heart-shaped" stethoscope that ends with "wi-fi" symbol as the chest piece.

The member card and the two-sided A4 format flyer are part of the branding implementation.
content.seo_description: Portfolio entry of the Dr.MacQ logo and printed branding implementation

content.title: novanet logo
content.description:
The numbers of elements present on the identity's emblem have a direct relation with the three entities present on the Holy Trinity. Also, these three parts have been placed in a way that resembles the old celtic Triskele; in this case the base of the triangle is on the right side instead of the bottom. The typography has been designed around the circle shaped element to match the design system.

The images show two different branding stationery applications, from 2018 and 2015 versions respectively.
content.seo_description: Portfolio entry of novanet logo images from 2018 and 2015 versions

content.title: Athlos logo
content.description:
The name for the brand emerged as a result of an exchange of ideas with the client; The concept for the design started from the geometric construction of the letters, as is the case of the 'A', where the  triangle tis drawn when a square and circle of equal width and height are superimposed. The rest of the letters of the name were created following the same design pattern to make them look like the same design system. From the start of the project, the client was integrated into the creative process, this logo design was very fluid, so the implementation of the brand came naturally.

Graphic identity design for [company] (https://www.instagram.com/athlos.ve/) of sportswear.

content.title: DrMacQ - Print and digital pieces
content.description:
For this project, it was required to design a A4 size two-sided flyer to explain how to use the telemedicine app to the company afiliates, a fillable PDF History form and a member card design for the Dr.MacQ brand.

The idea behind the two-sided flyer, was to explain the process on how to use the telemedicine app in a "step by step" way using icons to inform each stage and colors that fit with the brand palette; the first side shows the general process and the other side explains each step in detail. The fillable PDF form was generated in 3 different languages. In the case of the member card design, many of the design patterns of the two-sided flyer were taken.
content.seo_image_title: Member card design for DrMacQ brand
content.seo_image_alt: Image of the DR.MacQ's member card design
content.seo_description: Portfolio entry showing different design for the Dr.MacQ brand; a two-sided flyer, a fillable PDF form and a member card design

content.title: Ejsupply prints
content.description:
Before working on the print pieces of this project, a refresh was made to the company's logo: the amount of elements were reduced, gradients were removed from the emblem and a new typographic family was selected.

EJSUPPLY was an elevator maintenance service company, the result of the logo refreshing allowed me to use some shapes present on the logo. The print pieces designed for the stationery were: presentation card, letterhead, legal size envelope, number 11 type envelopes, service sheets, crew member cards, notebooks, room identifier signs and 2 tabloid size infographics to inform the emergency process in case of evacuation.
content.seo_image_alt: Image showing some of the EJSUPPLY printed pieces
content.seo_description: Portfolio entry of EJSUPPLY printed pieces with a brief story of project and general specifications of the designs

content.title: Take on Bar prints
content.description: This stationery design, follows the same design pattern from the logo: high contrast and minimal. One of the intentions, was to have the less amount elements across print pieces; a special design was made for the CEO of the company and another one for the bar tenders.
content.seo_image_alt: Image of a special design of the presentation card
content.seo_description: Portfolio entry of Take on Bar brand stationery design with general details about the project

content.title: Caracas Design 2015
content.description:
Caracas Design was a yearly congress that took place in the Venezuelan capital from 2013 to 2015. The event was an effort to bring together the country's graphic design community and offered talks, workshops and forums on poster, typography, animation, illustration, photography, editorial design, urban art and profession management.

The web design was inspired in official congress poster of the 2015 edition, the site was built on top of SiIlverstripe CMS, the layout was developed as a responsive CMS theme.
content.seo_image_title: Home page of the Caracas Design 2015 edition web site
content.seo_image_alt: Image showing Caracas Design 2015 congress information
content.seo_description: Portfolio entry of Caracas Design 2015 congress

content.title: Novanet web 2015
content.description: The novanet web 2015 version was a full static implementation with PHP/jQuery/CSS. The animations were made using CreateJS animation library, the layout was fixed to fit a large number of screen devices
content.seo_image_alt: Image of the home page of novanet 2015 web
content.seo_description: Portfolio entry of novanet web design 2015 version

content.title: Banco del libro web site
content.description:
The concept for the design is closely related to the shapes of the Bank of the Book logo; from this the disposition between the different elements was established. The aim was to navigate the website in such a way that it invited both children, youth and adults to be interested in the activities carried out by the Banco del Libro.

With all this in mind, an animation was designed and developed on the home page that features the logo and a navigation bar that respond to the interaction of the page visitor. Internal links maintain the same concept of animated menu and content generated through a content manager.

The graphic implementation was done in html / css, Flash animations and the open source CMS used is SilverStripe v2.4.5 (php, mysql), applied jointly to the installation and implementation of the news modules and image gallery. [Link] (http://galerias.bid-dimad.org/bid_14/?p=4191) to the project selection article at the Ibero-American Design Biennial IDB 2014.

content.seo_image_alt: Image of the design of the home page design of the banco del libro site
content.seo_description: Portfolio entry of Bank of the book web design
